title: Fundraiser Launched For Bondi Junction Hero Cop Amy Scott After Cancer Diagnosis | 10 News+
description: Inspector Amy Scott, the hero police officer who took down the Bondi Junction stabber Joel Cauchi in 2024, has been diagnosed with an aggressive form of breast cancer. There has been an outpouring of care from the community, her colleagues saying the mum of two is surrounded by love. A fundraiser set up for the hero cop has passed $170,000 and is still climbing, with everyday Aussies leaving heartfelt messages of support. title: Australian Formerly Detained In Iran Speaks Out On Mass Protests | 10 News+
description: Mass protests in Iran have entered a third week, the unrest growing bigger and bloodier each day. Harrowing video smuggled out of the country shows hundreds of body bags lining the streets of the capital Tehran. The ruling Islamic regime has imposed an internet and cellular blackout, isolating Iranians from the outside world. 10 News+ spoke to Kylie Moore-Gilbert, an Australian academic and expert in Middle Eastern politics, who spent two years in an Iranian jail on false charges of espionage. title: Golden Globes: Australian Star Rose Byrne Wins Best Actress | 10 News+
description: Sydney’s very own Rose Byrne has won big at the Golden Globes, winning the category of Best Actress in a Comedy or Musical for her performance in ‘If I Had Legs I’d Kick You’. She plays a woman named Linda who starts to lose her mind while juggling her daughter’s illness, her absent husband, her hostile relationship with her therapist, and a mysterious hole in her ceiling. Other Australians nominated this year include Jacob Elordi, Sarah Snook, and Joel Edgerton who all missed out on an award. title: Iran Protests: Over 500 Killed As Unrest Grows | 10 News+
description: Mass protests in Iran have entered a third week, with harrowing video showing hundreds of body bags lining the streets of the capital Tehran.  At least 544 people have been killed, and 10,000 others have been arrested and face the death penalty.  The ruling Islamic regime has imposed an internet and cellular blackout, isolating Iranians from the outside world. title: Controversy Over Victoria Bushfires Funding & Iran Protests Intensify | 10’s Late News
description: Tonight on 10’s Late News – Victorian Premier Jacinta Allan has defended her government’s funding of emergency services while touring bushfire-affected communities in the state’s west. Tens of thousands of Queenslanders face another anxious night with Ex-Tropical Cyclone Koji barrelling across the state, and unrest against the Iranian regime intensifies with the death toll from three-week-long demonstrations continuing to climb. description: Unrest against the Iranian regime is intensifying, as the death toll from three weeklong demonstrations climb. title: Australia's Ambassador to US Kevin Rudd Resigns | 10 News
description: Kevin Rudd will be stepping down as Ambassador to the United States of America at the end of March, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has announced this morning.  Rudd will become Global President of international relations think tank, The Asia Society, which he headed between 2021 and 2023.  Albanese confirmed that the decision to leave the position a year early was "entirely" of Rudd's own accord, praising the former Prime Minister's work in advancing economic relations between the two nations, as well as his work on the AUKUS submarine deal. title: Iran's Supreme Leader Issues Warning To US As Trump Weighs Military Intervention | 10 News
description: At least 648 demonstrators have been killed so far in the ongoing crackdown by Iranian security forces against anti-government demonstrations in Iran.  According to Iranian state TV, Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei has urged "American politicians to stop their deceit” and praised state-organised pro-government rallies held in the country on Monday.  It follows White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt stating air strikes are one of the "many options" still on the table for Trump but underscored that diplomacy is his first choice. title: Ice Agent Seen Slipping On Ice At Protest | 10 News
description: An ICE agent has become the subject of a viral video after comically slipping on ice while running towards anti-ICE protestors in Minneapolis.   After falling, the officer turns around and immediately sprints back to his vehicle, prompting cheers and laughter from the crowd.  The moment comes amid outrage and protest following the fatal shooting of 37-year-old Renee Nicole Good by an ICE agent in the city, now identified as 43-year-old Jonathan Ross.  Many online that have joked that ICE “can’t handle the ice”. title: Kangaroo Joey Goes For A Swim At Waterpark | 10 News
description: A theme park in Victoria had a surprise early morning visitor when a kangaroo decided to take a quick dip.  Funfields Themepark in Whittlesea say the roo hopped straight in before the park opened, paddled around briefly, before making its escape. title: Who Is Reza Pahlavi, The Exiled Prince Fuelling Iran's Protests | 10 News
description: He's the exiled crown prince calling for protesters to take back the streets of Iran, but who is Reza Pahlavi, and how much support does he actually have?  The 65-year-old heir to the Persian throne was just a teenager, living abroad in the United States, when the Islamic Revolution forced his father, the Shah of Iran, to flee the country in 1978.  10’s Late News explains. title: The Battle Over Canada's New Brunswick Neurological Syndrome of Unknown Cause | 10 News
description: A brain disease conspiracy battle is gripping a Canadian province, where one doctor claims the rare condition is widespread, but others don't agree.  In 2019, two people in the province of New Brunswick were diagnosed with a rare brain condition known as CJD which is considered both fatal, and potentially, contagious. title: Minnesota Sues Trump Administration Over Immigration Raids | 10 News
description: The U.S. State of Minnesota and its two largest cities are suing the Trump Administration in an effort to stop the inundation of immigration agents on their streets, after an ICE agent fatally shot Minneapolis woman Renee Good.  The State's Attorney General, alongside the Mayors for Minneapolis and St. Paul, say the Department of Homeland Security is violating the First Amendment and other constitutional protections. They are now seeking a temporary restraining order to stop the enforcement action or limit the operation.   Federal officials continue to defend the ICE agent who shot Ms Good. This has been widely rejected, including by Minnesota Governor Tim Waltz, arguing that Ms Good and her vehicle did not present a threat which warranted shots to be fired.
